subject: RE: [junit] How to test a main(String[] args) method?

messageBody:
Hi,

> I whould like to test a class with a main(String[] args)
> method. Depending
> on the input argument it executes one thing or the other. The
> problem is
> that on my main(String[] args) method at the end or when it
> founds an error,
> the method System.exit() is invoked. So when I define jUnit test cases
> (methods with prefix test), jUnits only runs the first test,
> because some
> System.exit() was invoked.
>
> Is there any way to test such kind of situations?

java.lang.System is final and does not implement interfaces,
so there is no chance to replace ist behaviour.

You may want to replace calls to System.exit() with calls against
an interface you define. Under test use an implementation which allows your
test code to chech if the exit method has been called by main() but which
does not exit the VM. In production use an implememtation which delegates to

System.exit().

Bernd
